comments.en:
The Epson color laser printers understand PCL 5e or PCL 6 but print only in grayscale with these languages. PostScript is an option which costs around 250 US$. This driver provided by Epson allows colour printing on the non-PostScript models and gives some additional options to the supported printers.

There is a version 1.0.4 of Epson's laser printer drivers. This version has no "alc4000" device. You have to use at least version 3.0.2, which you automatically get when you choose the AcuLaser C4000 as your printer model on Epson's driver download page. This driver version is prepared for both GhostScript 5.x and 6.x. For GhostScript 7.x or newer a small fix is needed: Execute the following command line in the main directory of the unpacked driver source package:

perl -p -i -e "s/GS_VERSION_MAJOR\s*==\s*6/GS_VERSION_MAJOR >= 6/" gdevescv.c gdevesmv.c

Then the driver also compiles with these versions of GhostScript.

On the home page of this driver is told that it only supports grayscale but I have tested it and it prints in colour. Unfortunately, the driver needs a lot of resources and so for high-resolution photos 512 MB RAM and a fast processor are recommended (or alternatively the PostScript module).
